Description: World War 2 lasted from 1939 to 1945 where the Axis(Germany Japan and Italy) fought against the Allies (Britain, the U.S, and the Soviet Union among others). The cause of the war was the 1939 Nazi invasion of Poland.
The 19th Amendment gave women the right to vote in name, where the right to vote can not be denied on the account of sex however there were still many loopholes to prevent women from voting.
Part of the Manhatten Project, atomic bombs were dropped in Hiroshama and Nagasaki marking the end of WW2.
This act prohibits discrimination on the basis of race,color,religion, sex or national origin.

World War 1 lasted from 1914 to 1918 between the Allies(Britain, France, Russia, Italy among others) and the Central Powers(Germany, Austria-Hungry, Bulgaria, and the Ottoman Empire). It was caused by the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria.
Neil Armstrong and Edwin "Buzz" Aldrin became the first humans on the moon
President JFK was assassinated by Lee Harvey Oswald on November 22,1963 when he was shot as he was riding in a motorcade in downtown Dallas.
The Berlin Wall was build by German Democratic Republic to stop people from going to West Berlin and it fall in 1989 where the mark the eventual end to the Cold War.
The Great Depression was the longest and worst economic downturn in U.S histroy beginning in 1929 and ending in the later 1930s.

Event: The Breakup of the Soviet Union
Description: While there are alot of factors and reasons that lead to the breakup of the soviet union, one major reason could have been Gorbachev's decision to allow elections with multi-party systems.
A proxy war fought from 1955 to 1975 between communist North Vietnam and South Vietnam backed by the United States.
A proxy war fought from 1950 to 1953 between communist North Korean and capitalist backed South Korea.
Bill Cllinton was charged with lying under oath and obstruction of justice.
The Nixon administration's attempt to cover up it's involvements in the June 17, 1972 burglary of the Democratic National Committee headquarters.
The Federal Meat Inspection Act was a legislation that establishes mandatory inspection of meat products before they can be sold.

Event: Ford Model T appeared on the market
Description: The Ford Model T was an influential and affordable mass-produced automoblie that revolutionized transportation and manufacturing through the assembly line.

The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People is a civil rights organization in the United States that works to promote racial equality and fight aginst discrimination through legal education and advocacy efforts.
The Titanic was a British luxury passenger ship that sank after hitting an iceberg; killing more than 1500 people.
The Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire was an industrial fire that resulted in the death of 146 workers predominantly young immigrant women; sparked significant reforms in labor.
The Women's Suffrage Procession was a historic march in Washington D.C where thousands of suffragettes gathered to advocate for women's right to vote the day before President Wilson's inauguration.
The Second Red Scare was a period of intense anti-communist sentiments characterized by government investigations blacklisting and heightened political repression.
The First Red Scare was a period of anti-communist sentiments and fear of radical political ideologies like socialism and anarchism.
